document_data.name: Hanged Hobgoblin House
document_data.mainbody: The '''Hanged Hobgoblin House''' or the ''''Obgoblin''' was the only [[tavern]] in the [[hamlet]] of [[White Ford]] in [[Archendale]] in the mid-to-late 14{{th}} century [[DR]].

Description.Structure: The tavern's ground floor had a taproom.
Description.Interior: Several impressive antler arrangements adorned the taproom on the tavern's ground floor, surrounding the mounted head of a [[hobgoblin]] with wide-open eyes. The head was known by the name "Urbert"
Description.Atmosphere: The Hanged Hobgoblin House served as a decent but unremarkable lodging option for White Ford offering all the conveniences typical of a village tavern, but its survival in a bigger community could have been questionable, possibly leading to closure.

document_data.Staff: At the Hanged Hobgoblin House, patrons could rely on friendly and eager-to-help staff members.
